issue.title: Cluster mempool tracking issue
issue.body:
What to review next:

* #34257 

---

Plan:
* Lowest level: generic utilities:
  * [x] [#29242 FeeFrac type](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29242)
    * [x] [#30535 Add FeeFrac::EvaluateFee](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30535)
      * [x] [#32240 Fix integer overflow in FeeFrac fuzz test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32240)
      * [x] [#32300 Fix different overflow in FeeFrac fuzz test](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32300)
  * [x] [#30160 BitSet type](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30160)
  * [x] [#30161 VecDeque type](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30161)
* Low level: operations on `DepGraph` type (dependencies/linearizations for a single cluster)
  * [x] [#30126 Base linearization algorithm](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30126)
    * [x] [#30605 Split tests from tests-of-tests](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30605)
    * [x] [#30857 Extend `DepGraph` functionality](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30857)
  * [x] [#30285 Merging and postprocessing of linearizations](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30285)
  * [x] [#30286 Optimized candidate search](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30286)
  * [x] [#32545 Replace linearization with SFL](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32545)
    * [x] [#34259 SFL chunk minimization](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34259)
  * [ ] [#34023 SFL optimizations](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34023)
    * [ ] [#34138 SFL cost model](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34138)
* Intermediate level: operations on `TxGraph` type (dependencies/linearizations for the entire mempool)
  * [x] [#31363 TxGraph basics](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31363)
    * [x] [#32151 TxGraph basics follow-up](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32151)
    * [x] [#32177 TxGraph increase fuzz coverage](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32177)
    * [x] [#32191 Make TxGraph fuzzing more deterministic](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32191)
    * [x] [#33354 Use enum Level instead of bool main_only](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33354)
    * [x] [#33862 Drop support for `TxGraph::Ref` move assignment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33862)
    * ~~[#33335 Randomize order of transactions](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33335)~~
    * [ ] [#34257 Deterministic order of transactions](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34257)
  * [x] [#31444 TxGraph mining/eviction](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31444)
    * [x] [#33469 Use `std::unordered_set` for skipped clusters](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33469)
  * [x] [#31553 TxGraph reorgs](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31553)
  * [x] [#32263 TxGraph work controls](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32263)
  * [x] [#33157 TxGraph memory usage](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33157)
  * [x] [#34085 TxGraph exploiting SFL better](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34085)
* High level: changes to mempool/validation
  * [x] [#31122 Changesets for mempool](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31122)
  * [x] [#33629 Cluster mempool implementation](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33629)
    * ~~[#28676 Old version](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/28676)~~
  * [x] [#33591 Cluster mempool optimizations and cleanups](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33591)
  * [x] [#34384 Remove epoch-based graph traversal](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34384)

labels.name: Tracking Issue
labels.description: Tracks longer-running projects and releases. Gathers TODOs, issues, PRs, and status updates.

events.body:
Wow, no ancestor/descendant limit would be great for unblocking UX hurdles in creating transactions! (Commenting to watch, also curious how someone like myself could help out here).

Edit: I see, this is going to be replaced with a cluster size limitation instead. What's the order of magnitude in which this number could be increased up to?

@summraznboi We are thinking of a cluster size limit of 50 or 64, depending on benchmarks when the full code is done. The limit is set by how fast we can run the basic cluster linearization algorithm (ancestor sort, chunking, post-processing, ...) quickly enough to run it at transaction relay time (taking into account that a single transaction may affect many clusters).
